t: Matthew 8
Jesus Cleanses a Leper
When*p He had come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed Him.
And behold, a leper came and worshiped Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”
Then*p Jesus put out His*i hand and touched him, saying, “I*r am*r willing;*r be*r cleansed.”*r Immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

And*p Jesus said to him, “See*r that*r you*r tell*r no*r one;*r but*r go*r your*r way,*r show*r yourself*r to*r the*r priest,*r and*r offer*r the*r gift*r that*r Moses*r commanded,*r as*r a*r testimony*r to*r them.”*r
Jesus Heals a Centurion’s Servant
Now*p when Jesus had entered Capernaum, a centurion came to Him, pleading with Him,
saying, “Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, dreadfully tormented.”
And*p Jesus said to him, “I*r will*r come*r and*r heal*r him.”*r
The*p centurion answered and said, “Lord, I am not worthy that You should come under my roof. But only speak a word, and my servant will be healed.
For I also am a man under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to this one,*i ‘Go,’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”*i
When*p Jesus heard it,*i He marveled, and said to those who followed, “Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r have*r not*r found*r such*r great*r faith,*r not*r even*r in*r Israel!*r
And*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r many*r will*r come*r from*r east*r and*r west,*r and*r sit*r down*r with*r Abraham,*r Isaac,*r and*r Jacob*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven.*r
But*r the*r sons*r of*r the*r kingdom*r will*r be*r cast*r out*r into*r outer*r darkness.*r There*r will*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.”*r
Then Jesus said to the centurion, “Go*r your*r way;*r and*r as*r you*r have*r believed,*r so*ir let*r it*r be*r done*r for*r you.”*r And his servant was healed that same hour.
Peter’s Mother-in-Law Healed
Now*p when Jesus had come into Peter’s house, He saw his wife’s mother lying sick with a fever.
So He touched her hand, and the fever left her. And she arose and served them.
Many Healed in the Evening
When*p evening had come, they brought to Him many who were demon-possessed. And He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick,
that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying: “He*pn Himself took our infirmities And*ld bore our sicknesses.”
The Cost of Discipleship
And*p when Jesus saw great multitudes about Him, He gave a command to depart to the other side.
Then a certain scribe came and said to Him, “Teacher, I will follow You wherever You go.”
And*p Jesus said to him, “Foxes*r have*r holes*r and*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r have*ir nests,*r but*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r nowhere*r to*r lay*r His*ir head.”*r
Then*p another of His disciples said to Him, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”
But*p Jesus said to him, “Follow*r Me,*r and*r let*r the*r dead*r bury*r their*r own*r dead.”*r
Wind and Wave Obey Jesus
Now*p when He got into a boat, His disciples followed Him.
And suddenly a great tempest arose on the sea, so that the boat was covered with the waves. But He was asleep.
Then His disciples came to Him*i and awoke Him, saying, “Lord, save us! We are perishing!”
But*p He said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r fearful,*r O*r you*r of*r little*r faith?”*r Then He arose and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.
So the men marveled, saying, “Who can this be, that even the winds and the sea obey Him?”
Two Demon-Possessed Men Healed
When*p He had come to the other side, to the country of the Gergesenes, there met Him two demon-possessed men,*i coming out of the tombs, exceedingly fierce, so that no one could pass that way.
And suddenly they cried out, saying, “What have we to do with You, Jesus, You Son of God? Have You come here to torment us before the time?”
Now*p a good way off from them there was a herd of many swine feeding.
So the demons begged Him, saying, “If You cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of swine.”

And*p He said to them, “Go.” So when they had come out, they went into the herd of swine. And suddenly the whole herd of swine ran violently down the steep place into the sea, and perished in the water.
Then*p those who kept them*i fled; and they went away into the city and told everything, including what had*i happened*i to the demon-possessed men.*i
And behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus. And when they saw Him, they begged Him*i to depart from their region.
